title: Structured logging infrastructure
description:
Set up internal/logger for structured logging throughout the application:
- Use logrus or zap for structured logging
- Support multiple log levels: debug, info, warn, error
- JSON format option for machine parsing
- File output option for daemon mode
- Context-aware logging with fields (document_id, operation, duration)
- Configurable via config package

All components will use this for consistent logging.

title: Main entry point and wiring
description:
Create main.go entry point to initialize and run the application:
- Initialize configuration (config package)
- Set up logging (logger package)
- Wire up dependency injection (manual or using wire/fx if needed)
- Invoke Cobra root command
- Handle top-level error conditions (config errors, missing dependencies)
- Signal handling for graceful shutdown
- Exit with appropriate exit codes

Final piece that assembles all components into executable binary.

title: OCR processing with Tesseract integration
description:
Implement internal/ocr package for extracting text from PDF pages:
- Use github.com/otiai10/gosseract as Tesseract wrapper
- Process: render PDF pages to images → run Tesseract with HOCR output → parse HOCR XML
- Extract text with positional information (bounding boxes)
- OCR result types: PageOCR with text and WordBoundingBox array
- Coordinate transformation from image space to PDF coordinate system
- Support configurable languages (default: eng, configurable via config)
- Handle OCR failures gracefully (log and continue)

Enables searchable text layer in PDFs.

title: Project scaffolding and build infrastructure
description:
Set up project infrastructure:
- Create Makefile for build automation (build, test, lint, install targets)
- Update go.mod with key dependencies: cobra, viper, rmapi, gosseract, pdfcpu
- Create directory structure: cmd/, internal/{config,logger,rmclient,state,sync,converter,ocr,pdfenhancer,daemon}/
- Set up GitHub Actions CI/CD: test on push, lint with golangci-lint, multi-platform builds
- Add .gitignore for Go projects

This is the foundation that all other work depends on.

title: PDF conversion from .rmdoc files
description:
Implement internal/converter to convert .rmdoc files to PDF:
- .rmdoc format: ZIP archive with page data (.rm files), metadata (JSON), optional original PDF
- Conversion strategies:
  1. Use rmapi built-in PDF export (if available)
  2. Reference rm2pdf library (github.com/rorycl/rm2pdf)
  3. Manual: render pages from .rm files to images → combine into PDF
- Handle metadata extraction (title, author, date)
- Output: standard PDF at {output_dir}/{folder}/{name}.pdf
- Preserve folder structure from reMarkable

Converts reMarkable documents to standard PDF format for OCR processing.

title: User documentation and examples
description:
Create comprehensive user documentation:
- README updates: project overview, features, use cases
- Installation instructions: go install, pre-built binaries, Homebrew (if available)
- Prerequisites: Go version, Tesseract installation, reMarkable account
- Configuration guide: config file format, environment variables, CLI flags
- Usage examples: auth, one-time sync, daemon mode, label filtering
- Troubleshooting: common errors, debugging tips, FAQ
- Architecture diagram (optional): component overview
- Contributing guidelines (optional)

Makes tool accessible and usable by end users.

title: Configuration management with Viper
description:
Implement internal/config package for centralized configuration management:
- Use Viper to support multiple config sources (CLI flags > env vars > config file > defaults)
- Config struct with all settings: OutputDir, Labels, OCREnabled, OCRLanguages, SyncInterval, StateFile, TesseractPath, LogLevel
- Config file support (~/.remarkable-sync.yaml)
- Environment variables (REMARKABLE_SYNC_*)
- Validation logic for required settings and path existence
- Default values for optional settings

Required by all components that need configuration.

title: Daemon mode with periodic sync
description:
Implement internal/daemon for long-running periodic sync:
- Ticker-based scheduling with configurable interval (default: 5 minutes, configurable via config)
- Graceful shutdown: handle SIGTERM/SIGINT for clean termination
- Signal handling to allow mid-sync completion before shutdown
- Error recovery: continue running even if individual sync attempts fail
- Logging for daemon lifecycle events (started, sync triggered, shutting down)
- Optional: health check HTTP endpoint for monitoring
- Optional: PID file management for process control

Enables hands-free continuous sync without manual intervention.

title: Sync orchestrator workflow coordination
description:
Implement internal/sync package to orchestrate the complete sync workflow:
- Main workflow: list docs from API → filter by labels → load state → identify new/changed → download → convert → OCR → enhance → update state
- Error handling: continue on individual document failures, collect errors, report at end
- Progress tracking and reporting (console output showing current document X/Y)
- Partial state updates (don't lose progress on failures)
- Dependencies: rmclient (API), state (tracking), converter (PDF), ocr (text extraction), pdfenhancer (text layer)
- Configurable via config package (output dir, labels, OCR enable/disable)

Core orchestration component that ties all pieces together into cohesive sync workflow.

title: Test fixtures and testdata setup
description:
Create testdata/ directory with comprehensive test fixtures:
- Sample .rmdoc files (small, realistic documents for testing converter)
- Sample PDFs with known content (for testing OCR and enhancement)
- Sample images for OCR testing (various handwriting styles)
- Mock API responses (JSON) for rmclient testing
- Organize by test category: testdata/{rmdoc,pdfs,images,api-mocks}/
- Document expected outputs (golden files) for comparison testing
- Keep test data small to avoid repository bloat

Enables realistic testing without hitting live reMarkable API.

title: Define shared type definitions
description:
Define shared type definitions across all internal packages:
- internal/rmclient/types.go: Document, Metadata, Collection types for reMarkable API
- internal/state/types.go: SyncState, DocumentState for tracking sync status
- internal/ocr/types.go: PageOCR, WordBoundingBox, Rectangle for OCR results
- internal/converter/types.go: ConversionOptions, ConversionResult for PDF conversion

These types are used throughout the application and must be defined early.

title: Unit tests for all internal packages
description:
Write comprehensive unit tests for all internal packages:
- Target: 80%+ code coverage across internal/ packages
- Use table-driven test pattern for multiple scenarios
- Mock external dependencies: rmapi (HTTP client), Tesseract (CLI calls), file system operations
- Use gomock or manual mocks for interfaces
- Test packages: config, logger, rmclient, state, sync, converter, ocr, pdfenhancer, daemon
- Focus on error handling, edge cases, boundary conditions
- Fast execution (mock external calls)

Ensures code quality and prevents regressions.

title: reMarkable API client wrapper
description:
Implement internal/rmclient as a wrapper around rmapi library:
- Wrapper for github.com/ddvk/rmapi (or github.com/juruen/rmapi)
- Authentication flow: Authenticate() with one-time code, token storage at ~/.remarkable-sync/token.json
- Operations: ListDocuments(labels), DownloadDocument(id), GetDocumentMetadata(id)
- Label filtering support to sync only tagged documents
- Error handling for API failures, rate limits, auth expiry
- Return structured types (use internal/rmclient/types.go)

Provides interface to reMarkable cloud for syncing documents.

title: Sync state management with JSON persistence
description:
Implement internal/state package for tracking synchronized documents:
- SyncState struct with map of DocumentState (ID -> state)
- JSON file persistence in output directory (.sync-state.json)
- Operations: Load(), Save(), NeedsSync(doc), MarkSynced(doc)
- Track: document ID, name, version, last modified, local path, OCR processed status, checksum
- Enable incremental sync (avoid re-downloading unchanged documents)
- Handle concurrent access gracefully (not required initially but consider for future)

Critical for efficient incremental sync workflow.

title: CLI commands with Cobra
description:
Implement cmd/ package with Cobra framework for CLI interface:
- Root command: global flags (--config, --output, --log-level, --labels)
- auth command: authenticate with reMarkable API (one-time setup)
- sync command: one-time sync with optional --labels filter, --force flag, --no-ocr flag
- daemon command: start daemon mode with --interval flag
- version command: display version information
- Clear help text and examples for each command
- Integrate with config package for flag processing
- Wire up to sync orchestrator and daemon mode

User-facing interface for all operations.

title: PDF enhancement with OCR text layer
description:
Implement internal/pdfenhancer to add searchable text layer to PDFs:
- Open original PDF from converter
- For each page: get OCR results (text + bounding boxes from internal/ocr)
- Create invisible text layer with positioned text matching OCR coordinates
- Text properties: transparent/invisible font, searchable but not visible
- Overlay text layer on original page preserving visual appearance
- Save enhanced PDF as {name}_ocr.pdf (or overwrite based on config)
- Handle coordinate system differences between OCR and PDF

Makes handwritten notes searchable while preserving original appearance.

title: Release automation with goreleaser
description:
Set up release automation with goreleaser:
- Create .goreleaser.yml configuration
- Multi-platform builds: Linux (amd64, arm64), macOS (amd64, arm64), Windows (amd64)
- GitHub releases: attach binaries, generate changelog from git tags
- Version management: semantic versioning, git tags
- Archive formats: tar.gz for Unix, zip for Windows
- Checksums and signatures for security
- Optional: Homebrew tap for macOS installation
- GitHub Actions workflow to trigger releases on tag push

Automates binary releases for all platforms.

title: PDF library integration research and setup
description:
Research and integrate PDF library for reading and writing PDFs:
- Evaluate github.com/pdfcpu/pdfcpu (open source, preferred)
- Fallback: github.com/unidoc/unipdf (commercial license but more features)
- Required capabilities: read existing PDFs, add text layers, coordinate handling
- Test with sample reMarkable PDFs to ensure compatibility
- Document library choice and rationale
- Create basic wrapper/utility functions for common operations

Foundation for PDF conversion and enhancement components.

title: Integration tests for end-to-end workflows
description:
Write integration tests for end-to-end workflows:
- Full sync workflow: auth → list → download → convert → OCR → enhance (using test fixtures)
- PDF conversion pipeline: .rmdoc → PDF (verify output format)
- OCR pipeline: PDF → images → OCR → text with bounding boxes
- Daemon lifecycle: startup → periodic sync → graceful shutdown
- CLI command execution: test each command with various flags
- Use testdata/ fixtures to avoid external dependencies
- Verify state file updates correctly
- Test error recovery scenarios

Validates complete user workflows work correctly.
